pullRequest.body:
Given a pair of roots, we can describe the "angle" between them using the pairing between root `i` and coroot `j` together with the reverse pairing.  This PR adds language for describing the various cases.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: I tried putting `pairing` into the statement of `RootPairing.eq_of_forall_coroot_root_eq`, but fixing the `rw` seems to require some wrestling.

> I tried putting `pairing` into the statement of `RootPairing.eq_of_forall_coroot_root_eq`, but fixing the `rw` seems to require some wrestling.

I just pushed [a commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10666/commits/43c5ec0486ceeb0a99ddabb124a2814bc4e971e2) which does this wrestling (we can't really use a definition until we write its API).

bors d+
In addition to the nitpicks highlighted below, I think it would be worth using `RootPairing.pairing` in the statement of `RootPairing.eq_of_forall_coroot_root_eq`.
I am happy with these changes. However as I have pushed some commits I think we need another reviewer's opinion before sending them to bors.

LGTM, one more comment.

Thanks a lot! Excited about where Lie theory in mathlib is going!

bors d+

Even though this looks nice here, I think we always end up regretting very short names:
```suggestion
/-- This is the pairing between roots and coroots.
def pairing : R := P.toLin (P.root i) (P.coroot j)
```
I claim `notation` is the right tool when names become a problem.

```suggestion
/-- A pair of roots is nonsymmetrizable if exactly one is fixed by the other's reflection. 

When `R` has no zero divisors, this is an obstruction to the existence of a Weyl-invariant form. -/
```

This is a term and even for proper nouns, we stick to our naming conventions:
```suggestion
def coxeterWeight : R := n P i j * n P j i
```

For better or worse, item 2 in our [general naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html#general-conventions) means `Prop`-valued definitions should be capitalised:
```suggestion
def IsOrthogonal : Prop := n P i j = 0 ∧ n P j i = 0
```
Likewise for `isNonSymmetrizable`, `isParallel`, `isImaginary`, `isDefinite`, `isUltraParallel`.

```suggestion
    P.IsCrystallographic ↔ ∀ i j, ∃ z : ℤ, z = P.pairing i j := by
```
(wasn't there a discussion about `∃ x, x = ...` vs `∃ x, ... = x` recently? I can't find it now, but maybe check if this matches the conclusion, if you can find it)
I am also struggling to find that thread but I remember the conclusion was the there was on conclusion!
Do we want to deprecate `eq_of_forall_coroot_root_eq` before removing it?
In this case I think we can escape without any deprecation: the lemma is only a couple of months old and I'd be **stunned** if anyone has dependent code.
That's a lot of definitions without API.
Should I cut some of it out for a later PR?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/RootSystem/Defs): Properties of pairs of roots
